com.linecorp.armeria.server.thrift

Class ThriftService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.linecorp.armeria.server.SimpleService
      • com.linecorp.armeria.server.thrift.ThriftService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Service

    public class ThriftService
extends SimpleService
    A Service that handles a Thrift call.
    See Also:
    ThriftProtocolFactories

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Set<SerializationFormat> allowedSerializationFormats()
      Returns the allowed serialization formats of this service.
      SerializationFormat defaultSerializationFormat()
      Returns the default serialization format of this service.
      Object implementation()
      Returns the Thrift service object that implements *.Iface or *.AsyncIface.
      Set<Class<?>> interfaces()
      Returns the Thrift service interfaces (*.Iface or *.AsyncIface) the Thrift service object implements.
      static ThriftService of(Object thriftService)
      Creates a new instance with the specified service implementation, supporting all thrift protocols and defaulting to TBinary protocol when the client doesn't specify one.
      static ThriftService of(Object thriftService, SerializationFormat defaultSerializationFormat)
      Creates a new instance with the specified service implementation and supporting all thrift protocols and defaulting to the specified defaultSerializationFormat when the client doesn't specify one.
      static ThriftService ofFormats(Object thriftService, SerializationFormat defaultSerializationFormat, Iterable<SerializationFormat> otherAllowedSerializationFormats)
      Creates a new instance with the specified service implementation and supporting the protocols specified in allowedSerializationFormats and defaulting to the specified defaultSerializationFormat when the client doesn't specify one.
      static ThriftService ofFormats(Object thriftService, SerializationFormat defaultSerializationFormat, SerializationFormat... otherAllowedSerializationFormats)
      Creates a new instance with the specified service implementation and supporting only the formats specified, defaulting to the specified defaultSerializationFormat when the client doesn't specify one.

    • Method Detail

      • of

        public static ThriftService of(Object thriftService)
        Creates a new instance with the specified service implementation, supporting all thrift protocols and defaulting to TBinary protocol when the client doesn't specify one. Currently, the only way to specify a serialization format is by using the HTTP session protocol and setting the Content-Type header to the appropriate SerializationFormat.mimeType.
        Parameters:
        thriftService - an implementation of *.Iface or *.AsyncIface service interface generated by the Apache Thrift compiler

      • of

        public static ThriftService of(Object thriftService,
                               SerializationFormat defaultSerializationFormat)
        Creates a new instance with the specified service implementation and supporting all thrift protocols and defaulting to the specified defaultSerializationFormat when the client doesn't specify one. Currently, the only way to specify a serialization format is by using the HTTP session protocol and setting the Content-Type header to the appropriate SerializationFormat.mimeType.
        Parameters:
        thriftService - an implementation of *.Iface or *.AsyncIface service interface generated by the Apache Thrift compiler
        defaultSerializationFormat - the default serialization format to use when not specified by the client

      • ofFormats

        public static ThriftService ofFormats(Object thriftService,
                                      SerializationFormat defaultSerializationFormat,
                                      SerializationFormat... otherAllowedSerializationFormats)
        Creates a new instance with the specified service implementation and supporting only the formats specified, defaulting to the specified defaultSerializationFormat when the client doesn't specify one. Currently, the only way to specify a serialization format is by using the HTTP session protocol and setting the Content-Type header to the appropriate SerializationFormat.mimeType.
        Parameters:
        thriftService - an implementation of *.Iface or *.AsyncIface service interface generated by the Apache Thrift compiler
        defaultSerializationFormat - the default serialization format to use when not specified by the client
        otherAllowedSerializationFormats - other serialization formats that should be supported by this service in addition to the default

      • ofFormats

        public static ThriftService ofFormats(Object thriftService,
                                      SerializationFormat defaultSerializationFormat,
                                      Iterable<SerializationFormat> otherAllowedSerializationFormats)
        Creates a new instance with the specified service implementation and supporting the protocols specified in allowedSerializationFormats and defaulting to the specified defaultSerializationFormat when the client doesn't specify one. Currently, the only way to specify a serialization format is by using the HTTP session protocol and setting the Content-Type header to the appropriate SerializationFormat.mimeType.
        Parameters:
        thriftService - an implementation of *.Iface or *.AsyncIface service interface generated by the Apache Thrift compiler
        defaultSerializationFormat - the default serialization format to use when not specified by the client
        otherAllowedSerializationFormats - other serialization formats that should be supported by this service in addition to the default

      • implementation

        public Object implementation()
        Returns the Thrift service object that implements *.Iface or *.AsyncIface.

      • interfaces

        public Set<Class<?>> interfaces()
        Returns the Thrift service interfaces (*.Iface or *.AsyncIface) the Thrift service object implements.

      • allowedSerializationFormats

        public Set<SerializationFormat> allowedSerializationFormats()
        Returns the allowed serialization formats of this service.

      • defaultSerializationFormat

        public SerializationFormat defaultSerializationFormat()
        Returns the default serialization format of this service.
